tool_description: Automatically classifies legal documents into predefined categories based on content analysis, formatting patterns, and legal document structure recognition.

document_text.description: Full text content of the document to classify

classification_taxonomy.description: List of possible document categories for classification

confidence_threshold.description: Minimum confidence score (0-100) required for automatic classification

enable_subcategories.description: Whether to identify subcategories within main document types

context_keywords.description: Additional keywords to help with classification context

error_messages: Document text too short: The document text must contain at least 50 words for reliable classification. Provide more complete text content.
Invalid classification taxonomy: All taxonomy categories must be non-empty strings. Check the classification_taxonomy parameter.
Confidence threshold out of range: confidence_threshold must be between 0 and 100. Adjust to a valid range.
Classification failed: Unable to classify document due to insufficient content or formatting. Manual review may be required.
usage: Provide the document_text for classification analysis. Optionally customize the classification_taxonomy, set confidence_threshold for accuracy control, enable_subcategories for detailed classification, and add context_keywords for improved accuracy.

subcategory.description: More specific subcategory if enable_subcategories is true

alternative_categories.description: Other possible categories with lower confidence scores

key_indicators.description: Text patterns or keywords that influenced the classification
